title: Why the U.S. Is Being Ominously Compared to Hungary and Turkey
description: A conversation with Max Fisher, who covers the decline of democracy around the world.

title: Russia Holds First Elections Since Ukraine Invasion
description: Voters are choosing local and regional governments, but the ranks of opposition candidates have been severely depleted by jail and exile.

title: Ukraine Attacks Russia in the Kharkiv Region, Swiftly Making Gains
description: Sweeping south from positions in the Kharkiv region in Ukraine’s northeast, Ukrainian forces have made their largest gains since routing Russia from Kyiv in April.

title: King Charles Names William and Kate Prince and Princess of Wales
description: In a palace statement, they indicated they would honor William’s late mother while still forging their own path.

title: King Charles III Will Be Announced  in His New Role on Saturday
description: The ceremony will be televised for the first time, the royal family confirmed to the Press Association.

title: Russia Holds First Elections Since Ukraine Invasion
description: Voters are choosing local and regional governments, but the ranks of opposition candidates have been severely depleted by jail and exile.

title: In His First Speech, King Charles III Pledges Service to Britain
description: On a day of mourning in the U.K. after the death of Queen Elizabeth, Charles’s ascent to the throne was a symbol of the continuity of the monarchy.

title: King Charles to Replace Queen Elizabeth on Bank Notes and Coins
description: Queen Elizabeth II faced right on British coins. Her son and successor might face the other way.

title: Charles addresses Britain on his first full day as monarch.
Here is the transcript of King Charles III’s inaugural address.
description: King Charles III honored his mother in his first speech to the nation as sovereign.

title: In London, Mourning, Remembrance and Tributes. And Some Shrugs.
description: Though mourning and grief were visible in Britain’s capital on Friday, some young Britons were more muted in their reaction to an institution that many called increasingly irrelevant.

title: Queen Elizabeth, and the Power and Limitations of Inspiring Women
description: Changing minds can be powerful, but history shows that changing societies takes more.

title: Balmoral, a Cherished Royal Getaway in Scotland, Becomes a Place of Pilgrimage
description: ‘If she had to go, this was the place,’ one visitor said. ‘She loved it.’

title: In London, Mourning, Remembrance and Tributes. And Some Shrugs.
description: Though mourning and grief were visible in Britain’s capital on Friday, some young Britons were more muted in their reaction to an institution that many called increasingly irrelevant.

title: What Will Happen to Queen Elizabeth’s Corgis?
description: Wherever the dogs end up, they may need to become accustomed to a home that is less luxurious than a royal castle.

title: Queen Elizabeth’s Death Renews British Empire Debate in Africa
description: While some in Africa paid tribute to the deceased monarch, others stressed Britain’s violent colonial history on the continent.

title: Camilla Becomes Queen Consort, Capping Years of Image Restoration
description: Upon Queen Elizabeth’s death, there was no question that as her son became King Charles III, Camilla would become Queen Consort. Elizabeth put the issue of Camilla’s role to rest earlier this year.

title: Harry Leaves Balmoral Castle, With Uncertain Plans Ahead
description: The Duke of Sussex was among the members of the royal family who traveled to the estate in Scotland where Queen Elizabeth II died.

title: Artists discuss how they turned the queen into an icon.
description: Queen Elizabeth II of Britain was one of the world’s most photographed and painted people. Three artists explain how they made portraits of the monarch that stood out from the crowd.

title: Putin Critic Aleksei Navalny Says Russia Revoked His Attorney-Client Privilege
description: Mr. Navalny said on Twitter that the prison administration had accused him of committing unspecified crimes by communicating with “accomplices through lawyers.”

title: The U.S. and Russia clash at the U.N. over military aid.
Queen Elizabeth’s Death Draws A More Muted Response in India
description: India declared a day of mourning, but the British colonial era evokes uncomfortable memories.

title: 2 Years After Deadly Fistfights, India and China Pull Back From Border
description: The two sides, after 16 rounds of talks, made an announcement a week before their leaders will meet in Uzbekistan.

title: Thousands of Angry Indonesians Gather to Protest Rising Fuel Prices
description: Labor activists, workers and students are demanding a reversal of an economic policy that the government says is necessary but remains deeply unpopular.

title: Premier League Soccer Games Are Postponed Out of Respect for the Queen
description: The league was one of many sports organizations in Britain to alter its schedule after the death of Queen Elizabeth II.

title: Rising energy prices amid a standoff with Russia over Ukraine are pushing Europe to spend big again.
Mourning Queen Elizabeth: Buckingham Palace Shares Tribute Details
Volker Türk, an Austrian Diplomat, Takes U.N. Human Rights Post
description: One of Volker Türk’s toughest challenges will be determining what to do about a highly critical report on China that his predecessor, Michelle Bachelet, released just before departing.

title: For Australians, Too, It’s the End of an Era
description: “I don’t think we’ll ever have the security again that we had with her,” said one Australian about the death of Queen Elizabeth II.

title: Many Sports Events Are Canceled Out of Respect For the Queen
description: After the death of Queen Elizabeth II, the British government left the decision over whether to postpone or cancel events up to individual sports organizations.

title: The U.S. will send an additional $675 million in military supplies to Ukraine, Austin says.
Meghan and Harry’s children could now inherit royal titles.
description: Now that their grandfather is king — and if the royal family adheres to convention — the children of the Duke and Duchess of Sussex should become Prince Archie and Princess Lilibet.

title: Filthy Plane Videos Ignite Debate About Airline Cleanliness
description: Recent social media posts suggest that the days of clean flights may be going the way of masks. And they’ve ignited a debate about who bears responsibility.

title: Updates: U.K. Prepares for New Era After Queen’s Death
description: King Charles III will return to London and address the nation on Friday afternoon. The country now enters a mourning period that continues until after her funeral.

title: Ukraine Claims Significant Gains Against Russia on Multiple Fronts
description: President Volodymyr Zelensky says Kyiv has “liberated” more than a thousand square kilometers of territory this month.

title: Kim Jong-un Says North Korea Will ‘Never Give Up’ Its Nuclear Weapons
description: The law authorizes a nuclear strike if an enemy tries to remove Kim Jong-un from power, the North’s state media reported.

title: Queen Elizabeth II: The One Constant in an Inconstant World
description: From fading empire to the Cold War to 1970s turmoil to Brexit to Covid, “she was always there.” What will Britain, and the world, do without her?

title: The U.S. announces sanctions on Iranian companies involved in Russia drone sales.
Your Friday Briefing
description: A special edition of the Briefing on the death of Queen Elizabeth II.

title: As Crises Mount, Europe Turns Once Again to Big Spending
description: The standoff with Russia over Ukraine and rising energy prices are rapidly overturning European economic orthodoxy, with barely a peep of dissent.

title: Olivia Colman and Claire Foy on Playing Queen Elizabeth II on ‘The Crown’
description: In “The Queen” and “The Crown,” actors took different approaches to get under the skin of the enigmatic monarch.
